resources.string: No ROM loaded. Save states can only be loaded for a specific rom and are put into a directory named after the rom.
Click on color field to edit when custom color is selected
Nearest Neighbour: Fastest but no interpolation
Bilinear Grid: Recommended - Fast and interpolates pixel borders
Bilinear: Slow and blurry but full bilinear interpolation
Time intervall in seconds between autosaves. Set 0 to disable.

Rin for android


This application is subject to the GPLv2 and later license. Thanks to homer for the gb emulation core, davexx for the rewind code, yukutu for the colorpicker, the linux kernel, bionic, lodepng, google for android and so on. Source code availaible at https://github.com/kdevkdev/rin

Help


Folders:Put roms under /sdcard/rin (or "external-storage-directory"/rin)

States:Are used to save the game progress, respectively to load it again. To load a state, first load the corresponding rom and then the state. States are saved into rin/save/sav.{"rom-name"}

Autocopy Roms:If enabled, roms are copied to /sdcard/rin (or "external-storage"/rin).

Sticky Keys:When dragging the finger out of a touch-key zone instead of releasing it, the key remains pressed. To realease it press it again normally.

Rewind: Hold the back key pressed to rewind

Config: Local config means rom specific, global config is for the whole app. The global palette, the autocopy rom, the framerate marker and the scale method are the only global settings. All other settings are local.

Screenshots: Are saved to rin/save/sav.{"rom-Name"}.
